qas.question: What was the cover date on Marvel Comics #1?
Who was Marvel/Timely's first true full-time editor?
Besides Simon, who co-created Captain America?
What is the name of the character created by Carl Burgos?
In what issue was Namor, The Sub-Mariner introduced?
How many copies did the first printing of Marvel Comics #1 sell?
What year did Joe Simon join Timely?
What was Bill Everett's job title?
When did Goodman disband Timely Comics, Inc?

context: Timely's first publication, <a4_0>Marvel Comics #1<a4_0/> (cover dated <a0_0>Oct. <b7_0>1939<b7_0/><a0_0/>), included the first appearance of Carl Burgos' android superhero <a3_0>the Human Torch<a3_0/>, and the first appearances of Bill Everett's anti-hero Namor the Sub-Mariner, among other features. The issue was a great success, with it and a second printing the following month selling, combined, nearly <b5_0>900,000<b5_0/> copies. While its contents came from an outside packager, Funnies, Inc., Timely had its own staff in place by the following year. The company's first true editor, <b8_0>writer-artist<b8_0/> <a1_0>Joe Simon<a1_0/>, teamed with artist and emerging industry notable <a2_0>Jack Kirby<a2_0/> to create one of the first patriotically themed superheroes, Captain America, in Captain America Comics #1 (March <b6_0>1941<b6_0/>). It, too, proved a hit, with sales of nearly one million. Goodman formed Timely Comics, Inc., beginning with comics cover-dated April 1941 or <b9_0>Spring 1941<b9_0/>.
